Dialogues: Ruth#Oh my, this is Grandma's bed!

#*Standing in front of the bed Ruth thinks
she can hear faint breaths behind her.*

#*Looking back at the painting the motif no longer
is unmoving like in her youth.

#*There are tiny black dots travelling the painting's sky.
Birds, she realizes. And in the grass a dark hole
has appeared.*

#*The bed is warm to the touch. As if someone has been sleeping there
just recently.*
